intro: Sida ternata, commonly known as smallleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, triangular leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida ternata is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
